==Events==
*[[141 BC]] &ndash; Liu Che, [[Posthumous name|posthumously]] known as [[Emperor Wu of Han]], assumes the throne over the [[Han Dynasty]] of China.
*[[632]] &ndash; The Last Sermon (Khutbah, [[Khutbatul Wada']]) of [[Prophet Muhammad]].
*[[1009]] &ndash; First known mention of [[Lithuania]], in the [[Annals of Quedlinburg|annals]] of the monastery of [[Quedlinburg]].
*[[1230]] &ndash; [[Bulgaria]]n [[Ivan Asen II of Bulgaria|tsar Ivan Asen II]] defeats [[Despotate of Epirus|Theodore of Epirus]] in the [[Battle of Klokotnitsa]].
*[[1276]] &ndash; [[Augsburg]] becomes an [[Imperial Free City]].
*[[1500]] &ndash; The fleet of [[Pedro Álvares Cabral]] leaves [[Lisbon]] for the [[Indies]]. The fleet will discover [[Brazil]] which lies within boundaries granted to Portugal in the [[Treaty of Tordesillas]].
*[[1566]] &ndash; [[David Rizzio]], private secretary to [[Mary, Queen of Scots]], is murdered in the [[Palace of Holyroodhouse]], [[Edinburgh]], Scotland.
*[[1765]] &ndash; After a campaign by the writer [[Voltaire]], judges in Paris posthumously exonerate [[Jean Calas]] of murdering his son. Calas had been tortured and executed in [[1762]] on the charge, though his son may have actually committed suicide.
*[[1796]] &ndash; [[Napoleon|Napoléon Bonaparte]] marries his first wife, [[Joséphine de Beauharnais]].
*[[1811]] &ndash; Paraguayan forces defeat [[Manuel Belgrano]] at the [[Battle of Tacuarí]].
*[[1841]] &ndash; The [[Supreme Court of the United States|U.S. Supreme Court]] rules in the ''[[United States v. The Amistad]]'' case that captive Africans who had seized control of the ship carrying them had been taken into [[slavery]] illegally.
*[[1842]] &ndash; [[Giuseppe Verdi]]'s third opera, ''[[Nabucco]]'', receives its première performance in [[Milan]]; its success establishes Verdi as one of Italy's foremost opera writers.
*  1842   &ndash; The first documented discovery of [[gold]] in [[California]] occurs at [[Rancho San Francisco]], six years before the [[California Gold Rush]].
*[[1847]] &ndash; [[Mexican–American War]]: The first large-scale [[amphibious assault]] in U.S. history is launched in the [[Siege of Veracruz]].
*[[1862]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: The {{USS|Monitor}} and {{Ship|CSS|Virginia}} fight to a draw in the [[Battle of Hampton Roads]], the first battle between two [[ironclad warship]]s.
*[[1896]] &ndash; Prime Minister [[Francesco Crispi]] resigns following the Italian defeat at the [[Battle of Adowa]].
*[[1908]] &ndash; [[Inter Milan]] was founded on ''Football Club Internazionale'', following a schism from the Milan Cricket and Football Club.
*[[1910]] &ndash; The [[Westmoreland County coal strike of 1910–1911|Westmoreland County coal strike]], involving 15,000 [[coal mining|coal miners]] represented by the [[United Mine Workers]], begins.
*[[1916]] &ndash; [[Mexican Revolution]]: [[Pancho Villa]] leads nearly 500 Mexican raiders in [[Battle of Columbus (1916)|an attack]] against the border town of [[Columbus, New Mexico]].
*[[1925]] &ndash; [[Pink's War]]: The first [[Royal Air Force]] operation conducted independently of the [[British Army]] or [[Royal Navy]] begins.
*[[1933]] &ndash; [[Great Depression]]: President [[Franklin D. Roosevelt]] submits the [[Emergency Banking Act]] to Congress, the first of his [[New Deal]] policies.
*[[1944]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: Japanese troops counter-attack American forces on [[Hill 700]] in [[Bougainville Island|Bougainville]] in a battle that would last five days.
*  1944   &ndash; World War II: [[Bombing of Tallinn in World War II|Soviet Army planes attack Tallinn]], [[Estonia]].
*[[1945]] &ndash; The [[Bombing of Tokyo]] by the [[United States Army Air Forces]] begin, one of the most destructive bombing raids in history.
*  1945   &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Japanese coup de main in French Indochina|A coup de main by Japanese forces]] in [[French Indochina]] removes the French from power.
*[[1946]] &ndash; [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton Wanderers]] [[Burnden Park disaster|stadium disaster]] at [[Burnden Park]], [[Bolton]], England, kills 33 and injures hundreds more.
*[[1954]] &ndash; [[McCarthyism]]: [[CBS]] television broadcasts the ''[[See It Now]]'' episode, "A Report on Senator [[Joseph McCarthy]]", produced by [[Fred Friendly]].
*[[1956]] &ndash; [[Red Army|Soviet forces]] suppress [[1956 Georgian demonstrations|mass demonstrations]] in the [[Georgian Soviet Socialist Republic|Georgian SSR]], reacting to [[Nikita Khrushchev]]'s [[de-Stalinization]] policy.
*[[1957]] &ndash; A [[Moment magnitude scale|magnitude]] [[1957 Andreanof Islands earthquake|8.3 earthquake]] in the [[Andreanof Islands]], Alaska triggers a Pacific-wide [[tsunami]] causing extensive damage to Hawaii and [[Oahu]].
*[[1959]] &ndash; The [[Barbie]] doll makes its debut at the [[American International Toy Fair]] in New York.
*[[1960]] &ndash; Dr. [[Belding Hibbard Scribner]] implants for the first time a [[shunt (medical)|shunt]] he invented into a patient, which allows the patient to receive [[hemodialysis]] on a regular basis.
*[[1961]] &ndash; [[Sputnik 9]] successfully launches, carrying a human dummy nicknamed [[Ivan Ivanovich (Vostok programme)|Ivan Ivanovich]], and demonstrating that [[Soviet Union]] was ready to begin [[human spaceflight]].
*[[1967]] &ndash; [[Trans World Airlines]] [[TWA Flight 553|Flight 553]], a [[Douglas Aircraft Company|Douglas]] [[McDonnell Douglas DC-9|DC-9-15]], crashes in a field in [[Concord Township, Champaign County, Ohio|Concord Township, Ohio]] following a [[mid-air collision]] with a [[Beechcraft Baron]], killing 26.
*[[1976]] &ndash; Forty-two people die in the 1976 [[Cavalese cable car disaster (1976)|Cavalese cable car disaster]], the worst cable-car accident to date.
*[[1977]] &ndash; The [[1977 Hanafi Siege|Hanafi Siege]]: In a thirty-nine-hour standoff, armed [[Hanafi]] Muslims seize three [[Washington, D.C.]], buildings, killing two and taking 149 hostage.
*[[1989]] &ndash; Financially troubled [[Eastern Air Lines]] filed for [[bankruptcy]].
*  1989   &ndash; The [[Polish People's Republic|Communist Polish government]] agrees to create a [[bicameral legislature]], marking the beginning of the [[Revolutions of 1989]].
*[[1991]] &ndash; [[March 1991 protests in Belgrade|Massive demonstrations]] are held against [[Slobodan Milošević]] in [[Belgrade]].
*[[1997]] &ndash; [[Comet Hale–Bopp]]: Observers in China, [[Mongolia]] and eastern [[Siberia]] are treated to a rare double feature as an [[eclipse]] permits Hale-Bopp to be seen during the day.
*[[2011]] &ndash; [[Space Shuttle Discovery|Space Shuttle ''Discovery'']] makes its final landing after 39 flights.
